meanings.def: the floor or ground at the bottom of a doorway, considered as the entrance to a building or room
examples: on the threshold She stood hesitating on the threshold.

meanings.def: the level at which something starts to happen or have an effect
examples: He has a low boredom threshold (= he gets bored easily).
I have a high pain threshold (= I can suffer a lot of pain before I start to react).
My earnings are just above the tax threshold (= more than the amount at which you start paying tax).
The number of people with the disease is reaching a critical threshold.
They earn wages below the decency threshold set by the EU.

meanings.def: the point just before a new situation, period of life, etc. begins
examples: on the threshold of something She felt as though she was on the threshold of a new life.
